Review.Titre: Phobio owes me $90
Review.Contenu: Phobio owes me $90. It was a trade in for a Motorola phone which I returned. Motorola denies responsibility and referred me to phobio. The phone has been processed out so it can't be returned. Phobio says Motorola is responsible. Motorola says Phobio is responsible. I have lost the value of the phone with no compensation.

Review.Titre: trade-in item correction was false
Review.Contenu: My trade-in item upon examination was said to be a different phone than what I claimed it was, but the phone they changed it to was not the phone I gave them. My trade in value fell $25. I'm not about to go through a whole process to try and get my $25 back. Just wanted to give you the "constructive feedback" requested, to whoever reads this anyway.

Review.Titre: stupid rules that NO OTHER COMPANY HAS!!!!
Review.Contenu: A ridiculous 2 week time limit that no company has to send a phone in and they expect you not to have a life or be 100% perfect when again, no other company does this. They also count the time that package even gets to you as part of the 2-week time limit. This company is shady and should go out of business for having such a dumb rule and even worse customer service.12/13/23 reply:That is a lie; even if those companies do have that policy, what they don't have is horrible customer service when a person DOES make a mistake. They also have a PHONE NUMBER to call and not an email that gets little to no replies to customer concerns. I sent my device in within the time frame but I had a small mistake that I corrected right away. It was YOUR CRAPPY CUSTOMER SERVICE that was the main concern that refused to grant me an extension FOR 2 WEEKS AFTER THE FACT!!! I am not in doubt about your "terms and service" I am in doubt about your horrible company that doesn't know how to run itself properly.Update reply 12/18/23:No, that is a lie. You refused after making me play "phone tag" by telling me to call Motorola. I spent 2 WEEKS arguing back and forth with whoever it was I emailing. This is especially true since I was told that it can be extended "for certain circumstances". Stop trying to defend your HORRIBLE customer service. As more proof of your HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. I emailed you 2 weeks ago about the money and STILL NO RESPONSE but you have time (within 3 days) to reply to your bad reviews. If find that hilarious that reviews get faster response time then your NONEXSITANT customer service email.

Review.Titre: $70  quote only paid $10 for my trade…
Review.Contenu: You said I would get $70 for my trade in but gave me 10 dollarsI would have kept my phone had I known you were going to screw me out of $60

Review.Titre: Sent phone in
Review.Contenu: Sent phone in, they claimed damaged, it was working with no issues when sent in mail. You try to contact them via email since no phone number, they never reply. They claimed it worth nothing when it was worth 40 more before shipment. They send you small box to cram the phone in also. My opinion run...never will use again.

Review.Titre: Suspicious!
Review.Contenu: Easy process. BUT, it took a long time to get the return box after offer agreed to, and I still do NOT have my CostCo credit. Entire process is taking too long. Makes me wonder if this is a scam!Received a response from my posting. We agree on date offer was agreed to as October 10th. I take strong exception to their claim return box was received by me on October 13. From my meticulous notes, box was not received October 13 as they claim but rather on  October 22. I did an overnight turn and had the return box to UPS October 23 at 10:24am. Today is 13 Novemeber, 21 days after return box was dropped off at UPS. Still do NOT have Costco credit. In addition, their response was addressed to "Idiot in Texas", not a very respectable and professional way to address a customer!

Review.Titre: Bait and switch
Review.Contenu: Bait and switch. Asked to upload my iMac serial number. Did so and was given an value of $500. Once the iMac was inspected by Phobio the value was dropped to $225 with the explanation the iMac didn’t match what I said it was - but the serial number was the same one I input. Phobio set the value of the trade in based on the serial number. That didn’t change, but the payout did. The “mistake” was made by Phobio, but I paid the price for it. Costco should find business partners that more accurately reflect Costco’s goal of integrity and solid customer service.

Review.Titre: Trade-in caution
Review.Contenu: Refund amount decreased every week-phone never changed.  There was not a display issue as stated by Phobio, just wouldn’t hold a charge.  Absolutely not what was advertised at new phone experience.  So disappointed, will never fall for this again.

Review.Titre: Very disappointed in this company
Review.Contenu: Very disappointed in this company. Total Bait and switch. Only after they received my device was the trade in value decreased by over 80% due to non-existent Pixel/screen issues. Device was in perfect working condition when sent in. I'm requesting a return rather than accepting the ridiculously low updated offer. I would not recommend this company if you expect to get the trade in value they originally offer.

Review.Titre: Trade in was outright rejected due to…
Review.Contenu: Trade in was outright rejected due to some vague reason out of my hands. Phone was in good working condition, completely wiped but they rejected it due to some MDM lock that I have never heard of before. Company provided no explanation of what it is or how can they help me remove it. Company has no phone to talk to a human. Horrible company and would avoid it if possible but also looking into other legal options.

Review.Titre: Very misleading guidelines for…
Review.Contenu: Very misleading guidelines for calculating value. Not worth the trouble.

Review.Titre: Never received our shop card
Review.Contenu: We submitted our iPad and received an email stating that we would receive our shop card within three business days. All I received was this request for a review but no shop card. I’m very concerned that Costco would partner with a company that does not seem to respond to my 2 requests for assistance through their webpage. I will be contacting Costco directly to make a formal complaint.

Review.Titre: Took too long to evaluate
Review.Contenu: Took too long to evaluate.  Motorola had already charged my credit card for the return and it was a pain to get it back.

Review.Titre: Someone at Phobio stole my phone and they tried to replace it with a cheaper phone
Review.Contenu: Two of my three phone trade-ins went fine. My 3rd was horrible. They basically lost my cell phone and then returned some cheaper iphone. When I talked with customer service, he said that they returned my phone (confirmed by the IMEI number). They did not send that phone back. Now I am out my $35 quoted gift card and my phone. I just want my phone back. I did return the cheap phone and was supposed to get a gift card to honor my original phone because clearly someone at Phobio stole the phone and switched it with a cheaper version. I never got the gift card or my phone.

Review.Titre: The cost I was quoted was dropped…
Review.Contenu: The cost I was quoted was dropped dramatically and when I tried to contact I got no response. Google FI informed me this was typical and common from Phobio and in the future to not trade in phones because of scams like this.

Review.Titre: Nothing wrong with the phone other than…
Review.Contenu: Nothing wrong with the phone other than normal [for the age] light burned imagery on screen that seriously barely was visible, especially on dark mode. Kind of lame when they make an offer...enter the condition as good, jumps through hoops---only to have them low ball you, and it becomes a hassle. Be prepared to not get the offer you accept on a used phone, as they want the people that get rid of phones every two years. This was a 5 to 6 year old S20 that was mint and got a trivial reassessment. Just donate your phone rather than deal with this scam.

Review.Titre: Motorola should be ashamed
Review.Contenu: Trade in process itself was not too difficult but my experience with Motorola has been one of my worst purchase experiences of my life. 6 different phone calls and call backs, over 3 hours of call time ALL well within 14 days to return the phone BUT yet here I am with the same piece of S*** Motorola edge plus. NEVER AGAIN WILL I RECOMMEND.

Review.Titre: Broke the laptop I sent in and tried to…
Review.Contenu: Broke the laptop I sent in and tried to blame me claiming the they don’t intentionally or accidentally break item. Have supposedly recently disconnected the phone for support so you can’t speak directly with a person. Email is their only path to discussing their shortcomings. I would leave zero stars if it was an option. Take pictures of everything so you don’t end up like me where they try to lowball you due to damage caused by their incompetence.

Review.Titre: They mishandled my MacBook Pro and…
Review.Contenu: They mishandled my MacBook Pro and caused the battery to swell and then denied my trade in value and ruined my $2200 computer. I would not ever use this service, best just sell to anyone else. The customer service is horrible too and lacks any care that normally would be seen when working with Costco.

Review.Titre: Long wait for payment.
Review.Contenu: I got the message that my product passed inspection and I should receive my Costco gift card shortly.  It’s been a week and it still says “payment processing”.  Regretfully I have two other devices in the que with phobio and they are still processing also.  I am very disappointed in their ability to pay as I’ve yet to receive my payment.  Do not recommend

Review.Titre: Very upset with my experience
Review.Contenu: Very upset with my experience. First had to drive around as it said to drop at Fed ex but postage slip was for ups. Took the time to follow the instructions for erasing and reinstalling software and even cleaned the computer up real nice.  The computer I sent in was in good working condition however somehow when they unpacked it they said it was “broken”. Had I known this was the experience I would be dealing with I would have given the computer away but now I am left with a broken computer. Reviews seem to indicate that this is a common issue.

Review.Titre: Traded my iPhone 11 max pro in for a…
Review.Contenu: Traded my iPhone 11 max pro in for a new device through apple and get an email saying I am going to receive ZERO trade back value due to “device missing enclosure or back glass”. This device was in PERFECT condition before sending it out, I even took photos for proof, afraid something like this would happen. I’m not sure if something got messed up during shipment but the phone I sent had absolutely nothing wrong with it. I’ve never had an issue with apple trade in before. Now I’m waiting for an email from phobio. Hopefully they can fix this issue and give me what I deserve. It’s really not fair to customers to be given nothing after sending in their perfect-condition phone and receive barely any reasoning.

Review.Titre: 2 weeks no Payment yet
Review.Contenu: It’s been 2 weeks, and I have not received my payment.  Looks very sketchy.Edit 1 day:  Phobio customer service contacted showing “payment processing” in trade dashboard.  Phobio CS said it is up to me to contact Costco now.  Disappointed with how hard it has been.  People beware.

Review.Titre: Costco should drop Phobio as a partner IMMEDIATELY.
Review.Contenu: Multiple issues with doing a trade-in for an iMac. First of all, Phobio sent me a shipping label without a bar code on it, so UPS wouldn’t ship it. Secondly, I requested a new shipping label through their “dashboard” and got no response. Repeating request didn’t help until I contacted Costco customer service to complain and then finally I received a new shipping label by email. Thirdly, they docked the estimated value of my trade-in for two erroneous reasons. One reason was because they received my trade-in “late” (due to the shipping label fiasco, which was THEIR FAULT), and secondly because the exact model of my trade-in didn’t match what I had put into their form due to there not being an exact match available. In fact, the machine I traded in was BETTER than what I had specified, not worse. Again, this was their fault. I explained that situation through their dashboard again, and again with no response. I also found a customer service phone number for them on their website, but the number responds with a computer that says they don’t take customer service calls over the phone and to send email instead. Sending them email also gets no response. The worst customer service I’ve ever seen. Costco should drop them as a partner IMMEDIATELY.Note: If Phobio replies to this review with some offer to help, it’s WAY TOO LATE--they should have responded to the multiple requests I made to their customer service at the time when I needed help.

Review.Titre: COULD NOT GET THEIR LINK TO WORK
Review.Contenu: I COULD NOT ACCEPT MY TRADE IN OFFER THRU THE EMAIL SENT. HAD TO CONTACT PURETALK CUSTOMER SERVICE TO GET IT COMPLETED.

Review.Titre: Check with your carrier BEFORE buying from Costco!
Review.Contenu: I received a paltry sum for my phone. Lesson: Be careful when you buy a phone from Costco and use their trade-in system, especially, since you can trade in your phone and pay off the balance in increments with NO INTEREST if purchased from your carrier.

Review.Titre: They stole my phones and have accused…
Review.Contenu: They stole my phones and have accused me of sending an empty box. They also decided not to keep me informed of their “investigation.” I had to email back asking them what’s going on. They have poor communication skills and refuse to talk to their customers.

Review.Titre: Waste of time and effort
Review.Contenu: We started the iPad trade in process December 12 and we’re informed they received our iPad December 30.  It was inspected and accepted and we received notification we would receive a $20 gift card, less than 10% of what they will re-sell it for.  We then received two more notifications we would receive payment soon.  Then we received another notification we would receive payment in three days.  On January 20 we received a request to review the trade in process.  WE STILL HAVE NOT RECEIVED ANY MONEY OR GIFT CARD.   What a wasted of time packaging, driving to town to mail, and reading 8 stupid emails.

Review.Titre: Bait and Switch… rip off …
Review.Contenu: I think it was a bait and switch plan from the get go, the phone worked perfectly when we last used it… I did not see any time requirement once the packing material arrived and the value stated was a quarter of what was promised. You got me good job! Zero stars if it was an option.

Review.Titre: THINK TWICE!!!
Review.Contenu: I sent in my 2021 iMac in perfect condition and according to Phobio, there was no issue with the box, but they must had dropped it,  they value my computer 1/5 of the original quote.  I asked them to get more pictures, and they said they can't help me with any request.  VERY FRUSTRATING!!!! Never again!

Review.Contenu: I submitted all that was required of me, I sent my equipment in hopes of receiving my $120 gift card which I never did. I had moved passed the fact that I was deceived by Phobio.

However, after 4 months, and a few attempts to reach out through the provided contact platform, I still have yet to receive my digital costco card worth $625.

Review.Titre: No customer service
Review.Contenu: Bad experience with the whole process, I should have just went through apple for the buy back program. There was a problem when I returned my laptop as it appears to have been taken out of the shipping box when I sent it back. They had to wait for UPS to investigate to see what happened. Their whole communication was not good, I asked for a phone number to actually talk with someone and never got one. I was the one who had to keep following up with them to see how the process was going. I never got a clear response from anyone and could never speak to anyone. It took almost 3 months to get my Costco credit for my laptop. Will never use this company again

Review.Titre: I Felt like it was a little bait and…
Review.Contenu: I Felt like it was a little bait and switch.Advised they would provide a trade-in amount only to decrease significantly - they knew by age of devices and should have priced appropriately.

Review.Titre: Haven’t received payment
Review.Contenu: It’s been a couple of weeks since the trade was accepted and approved and I’m still waiting for my gift card. Haven’t heard  anything from you guys about it either.Confirmed payment would be sent out on June 29. It’s end of day July 18-no payment.

Review.Titre: An absolute scam
Review.Contenu: An absolute scam. Unethical and dishonest business. They delayed sending me the return box so I can send my trade-in phone and lied about the date of arrival. They stated it was a FedEx label when in fact it was UPS. Label issued Nov 28 (according to the UPS tracking) but box was delayed to UOS by Phobio. As a result box arrived on Dec 8, late afternoon. Phone sent back on Dec 9. Received a note from Phobio on Dec 21 that my trade in was cancelled. After many emails, they had the audacity to state they cancelled my trade in because was late by 6 days. What??? Trade in is 21 days from when I received the box, on December 8. I guess Phobio people missed the math classes, or they had none. This is not a business. Check the number of complaints with Better Business Bureau and the investigations within their business. This time you messed with the wrong person.

Review.Contenu: I have trade in but never received the payment.  Calling Costco, the agent gave me Phobio help email.  Sending email to them they refer back to Costco instead of taking Care of my case.  as of now I still don't have the payment for my trade in yet.

Review.Titre: Perfect trade in when shipped but damaged in transit?
Review.Contenu: I traded in a gen 2 iPad that was in perfect condition. It lived in a case it’s entire life with me and was never dropped or damaged. After trading it in, I was informed there was a crack at the bottom. Obviously happened during shipping and now I have the pay the price for bad shipping materials and\or carrier damage. Not fair at all that my trade in value went from $60 to $21 and I’m left with no alternative outside of just having the device shipped back. Terrible!

Review.Titre: Poor Customer Service! Do Not use this company!
Review.Contenu: I submitted my trade and everything was working fine with my phone.  Then I get an email saying that my phone had a problem and the offer went from $120 to $24.  I totally think this is unfair, because maybe you damaged my phone? It was working just fine when I mailed it in. If I asked for it back, then perhaps I wouldn't be able to sell it to someone because of the damage that you may have done. I've since voiced my comments about your company to Costco as well as providing feedback of how poor this service is. I've also tried calling and emailing your company and I have received no response.  Such poor customer service in my opinion.  I would never recommend this to anyone, and I think you robbed me of my perfectly working iphone X

It was working just fine when it left my house. They took the trade in value from $470 to $118. Disputing with Apple now. This company is a scam and I’ll never trade in another Apple device through them again.

Review.Contenu: I still haven’t received my Costco card for my iPhone exchange

Review.Titre: The process from beginning to end was…
Review.Contenu: The process from beginning to end was slow. I answered all of the prequalifying truthfully yet I only received half the money I was offered. If it sounds too good to be true, it usually is. Costco don't use this company.

Review.Titre: We felt that we were deceived
Review.Contenu: We felt that we were deceived.  We read the information about our computer directly to you over the phone, and you gave us a price.  Then it felt like a bait and switch.  You said the computer received was not the same one we told you it was.  We read the specs directly from our computer to you.  You lowered the price from $270 to $110.

Review.Titre: Too long of a process
Review.Contenu: Too long of a process, still havnt received my funds

Review.Titre: The process was misleading because it…
Review.Contenu: The process was misleading because it would not let me go through the process until I accepted 35 which I was under the impression that was just a temporary estimate until my watch was received and examined according to the information I read I would get a text or email with the quote offer and then I could accept or refuse then only to find out that was not how it worked and I got a whole $35 for a perfectly good working watch with no damage what so ever.   I even sent an email saying i did not want to accept that but no one bothered to respond.  So I am very very unhappy

Review.Titre: My iPad screen was not cracked when i…
Review.Contenu: My iPad screen was not cracked when i shipped it to you for a $100 trade-in value offered through Costco.  I was incentivized to buy the new iPad Pro based on the combo of the sale price and trade-in value. i had a high-quality product to trade (why else do it?).  I packed my iPad securely using the packing material you provided.  Honestly, i feel duped.  Not cool, people.

Review.Titre: Very disappointed in the amount we…
Review.Contenu: Very disappointed in the amount we received.  The reason for the lower amount from what I was originally given was very unclear. The picture that was sent showing why, was not very explanatory.   I will not trade in with them again.

Review.Titre: I have not receive my trade in yet…
Review.Contenu: I have not receive my trade in yet although it is only $10.

Review.Titre: not happy that I was quoted one price…
Review.Contenu: not happy that I was quoted one price and then it was adjusted once I had sent in my items.  All of my items were adjust to more than half (closer to a third of the initial offering). This has happened to other people that I know of. I will not be using this service again.

Review.Titre: They never sent me my shipping kit
Review.Contenu: They never sent me my shipping kit. Waste of time.

Review.Titre: Very disappointed
Review.Contenu: Very disappointed.  There was a large difference between what was promised and what was paid.  It feels very disingenuous and approaching fraud.  This is so out of place from Costco and my experience with the quality of products and services offered by Costco.  I would not participate in this service again.

Review.Titre: They dock you for damage in transit
Review.Contenu: Apparently my old device got damaged in transit and they did not honor the trade in

Review.Titre: I never got an Email telling me they…
Review.Contenu: I never got an Email telling me they Received it .

Review.Titre: Not What I’d expected…
Review.Contenu: Price too low and I still haven’t gotten my gift card, yet.  Which means it takes too long for too little money.

Review.Titre: The estimated value and the actual were…
Review.Contenu: The estimated value and the actual were far off from each other.  The phone was worth more than they ended up giving.

Review.Titre: Long time between when trade in item…
Review.Contenu: Long time between when trade in item was received and accepted and the arrival of the gift card. Over 3 weeks of time from when the item shipped and the gift card was received. Otherwise the program worked fine but since this was used during the upgrade of a tablet I use daily in my workflow it was disruptive and I would not likely use this service again unless time between trade receipt and gift card receipt decreased significantly. This was especially frustrating since there were no status or tracking updates once they had accepted leaving me unsure my gift card was even actually sent until it arrived in the mail 2 weeks later.

Review.Titre: Smooth Process until payment
Review.Contenu: Clear instructions, easy trade in. I received an email two weeks ago that payment is processing for both phones. Costco digital shop card will be emailed in 3 business days. I have contacted customer service via email, got no answer. Still waiting for my payment.

Review.Titre: Payment not issued as promised
Review.Contenu: Payment not issued as promised.  No response to contact attempts.

Review.Titre: No feedback.
Review.Contenu: My original quoted trade-in price was $120.   After receipt, the price went down to $48.   There was NO EXPLANATION at all.   Just the option to accept or reject.    That is pretty poor communication.  I am confident you can do better than that in the future.Best,

Review.Titre: It was fine
Review.Contenu: It was fine. My estimated laptop refund was supposed to be $160 and went to $0. The condition described was not something listed in the up-front selv-eval. and the time window provided to turn it around I didn't meet because it was way too short. Basically phobio just got my recycled laptop parts on a perfectly good working laptop, and now I am left without one.

Review.Titre: Quoted trade value not honored
Review.Contenu: Their quoted trade in value dropped from $120 to $28 after they “inspected” my tablet. A claimed display defect (a white spot) seems to be Phobio’s standard ploy these days and I’ll have none of it and requested a return. I shipped a pristine device to them and their bad faith representation of its condition reflects poorly on Phobio and their partner Costco.

Review.Titre: Painstakingly slow
Review.Contenu: The whole process is painstakingly slow. I should’ve known from their “offer” that they were busy and didn’t need my beloved computer. I sent my computer the same day as received mailing materials, that alone took over three weeks. I waited, and waited, and waited, patiently for my ecard, until nearly 7 weeks from when I initiated the swap. Only to find it had been delivered by an additional company and fallen in my spam box a week in a haIf prior. I would not use this service again and recommend against any friends or family working with this company.

Review.Titre: Trade value was much lower than…
Review.Contenu: Trade value was much lower than expected given the age and good cosmetic and working condition of device.  Barely worth the effort of going through the process.  Would not do again.

Review.Titre: payment not received yet
Review.Contenu: payment not received yet. Suppose to arrive within 3 business days after 4/14/23.  Today is 4/29/23.UPDATE May 5, 2023: I always check spam and the digital card was never sent. Worst part is I sent message to Phobio's gethelp email five days ago.  No reply.

Review.Titre: I sent my iPhone on Aug 2
Review.Contenu: I sent my iPhone on Aug 2, 2023 and it still shows in transit 3 weeks later, no way to contact support and figure out where it is, have a sinking feeling I got scammed

Review.Titre: Lack of information
Review.Contenu: I was not informed that I needed to go to the  apple store and remove my phone from the icloud. I was also not informed that I needed to contact my previous provider and have them remove a transfer lock on the phone. I had to find out both these items the hard way. This lack of information delayed the process but it was finally resolved.

Review.Titre: Took way too long
Review.Contenu: Took way too long, lack of communication, and somehow made it seem that it was my fault for that, reduced my amount because if it even though j did everything right, no box was ever shipped to me

Review.Titre: The process took way too long and had…
Review.Contenu: The process took way too long and had too many gaps to complete.  I had to reach out twice beyond my original ask  to obtain the "mail back boxes".  It then took about a week to get them, and then well over a week only to get an email saying "it was being processed".  I'm also amazed at how little I got back for a fully functioning watch.  The marketing for the "trade in" look a lot more promising than the reality of the gift cards value.  I feel a bit juked.

Review.Titre: Phobio ignored problems with its…
Review.Contenu: Phobio ignored problems with its arrangement with UPS for shipping an old computer as part of an offer from Costco--and expected me to go around UPS and its requirements to send it. All of that was very time consuming and frustrating.

Review.Titre: I haven’t received my payment
Review.Contenu: I haven’t received my payment. It my not be your fault with all the holiday mail, but your customer service number is also not open.  I just emailed getsupport@phobio, so I hope to hear something back

Review.Titre: I sent in my phone on Sept-14
Review.Contenu: I sent in my phone on Sept-14.  I was told it was lost.  Sent multiple follow up emails asking what happened and received NO response.  Needed someone from Costco to contact Phobio.  Finally settled on Jan-23.  The only reason it wasn't zero stars is that I eventually got the credit.Your response would have been nice to one of the eight emails that I sent through your website.  I was  completely in the dark.  It doesn't matter how good your policies and practices are if you can't communicate them with your customers.  We just bought a new laptop and will NOT be using Phobio to deal with the previous machine.

Review.Titre: I have not received any remuneration…
Review.Contenu: I have not received any remuneration for the iPads I returned!.And you want me to review experience, how daft do you get?

Review.Titre: Device inspected on 5/26 but still waiting
Review.Contenu: Device inspected on 5/26 but still trade in payment is still "in processing" on 6/13.  Shouldn't take so long for a digital  shopping card.

Review.Titre: I submitted my trade in information in…
Review.Contenu: I submitted my trade in information in August requesting a shipping package which never came. I had to request a confirmation number and another shipping package the first part of October. Then, the price dropped by $60! The reason was because it was late!! Not my fault and very irritating.

Review.Titre: The process took forever
Review.Contenu: The process took forever. Every aspect was way too slow. When reaching out to customer service they didn't help. They get 2 stars instead of 1 because the price they offered was great.

Review.Titre: Interesting to receive a survey before…
Review.Contenu: Interesting to receive a survey before getting paid.  Your Marketing department should know better than doing that!

Review.Titre: The time it it took for my refund this…
Review.Contenu: The time it it took for my refund this all started 0n11/-4/22 . I received my gift card today 12/10/2022 .This is ridiculous.if I had traded with Apple I would have received my credit within 15 days

Review.Titre: Bait and switch
Review.Contenu: Took too long to process my 1 item trade in, email snails & counter offer was EXTREMELY low, also return instructions read free to drop at FedEx but was actually ups label, overall slow ean disappointing will never use again!

Review.Titre: Was supposed to get 100 $ for my Mac, but...
Review.Contenu: Was supposed to get 100 $ for my Mac, ended up with 15 $, not cash but in Apple Store credits. A lot of time waisted for 15 $.

Review.Titre: Not sure how my phone went from a $200…
Review.Contenu: Not sure how my phone went from a $200 estimate to an $80 payout.

Review.Titre: I should have gotten more money for the…
Review.Contenu: I should have gotten more money for the return of my phone.

Review.Titre: Shipping boxes too small and too tigh…
Review.Contenu: Shipping boxes too small and too tight for placement of phones.  Should a product to make it easier to assemble.  Don’t know how my phone ended up missing from box after inserting into the shipping box.  What happened during shipment, handling process? Was it eventually found? Did it get stolen? We had to go thru alot to show proof of shipping ticket.  Not happy about it.  How often does this occur?

Review.Titre: You nitpicked little things to take the…
Review.Contenu: You nitpicked little things to take the trade in value to almost nothing.

Review.Titre: I traded in an iPad Pro
Review.Contenu: I traded in an iPad Pro. I filled out a form with information about it. My trade in was estimated at $100. Communication with Phobio was good throughout the process. A shipping carton and instructions was mailed to me. The final trade in price was $30 which feels like bait and switch.

Review.Titre: It’s been over 2 weeks and have not…
Review.Contenu: It’s been over 2 weeks and have not received payment yet

Review.Titre: I was suppose to get ~$135 for my iPad…
Review.Contenu: I was suppose to get ~$135 for my iPad trade in but I only got $53.  they said I had 2 pixels out that I never saw or experience any issues.  the device was in a case and had a screen saver.  never been dropped or scratched.  perfect visual condition.  not sure if the iPad with the 2 pixels out was mine.

Review.Titre: Your database of Mac models is deficient
Review.Contenu: Your database of Mac models is deficient. My legitimate serial number was not identified with a model. Instead I had to choose the model from limited choices. The exact model I had was not included in the choices and I picked the closest model and was given a quote that turned out to be inaccurate when my actual model was evaluated.

Review.Titre: Communication has been lacking
Review.Contenu: Communication has been lacking. Looking at the website, the shipping, and inspection process was smooth and quick. Payment however, can’t say the same. Payment has been processing for two weeks now and still nothing…

Review.Titre: Bogus Valuation
Review.Contenu: Deducted $130 (70%) of an estimated trade-in value of $185. for two chips on the frame of the computer screen that had no impact on performance or viewability.No response from customer service contesting the reduction. It was take it or leave it (and do it quickly or we will send the computer back to you).

Review.Titre: I have been trying to contact customer.…
Review.Contenu: I have been trying to contact customer service by email and phone several times , no replies .I don't receive the Costco card even I got a trade in confirmation email 12 days ago. I asked the digital card.

Review.Titre: I know that the fine print said the…
Review.Contenu: I know that the fine print said the amount of the trade-in could change after you received the item. However, I never expected it to go down from $150 to $53! It was a perfectly working iPad; just needed to be charged too often.

Review.Titre: The overall experience took too long
Review.Contenu: The overall experience took too long. After going through all the steps required, including waiting for shipping, I was then told that I wasn't going to get any refund for my device, to then wait for it to ship back. The whole thing took over a month, just to have me be told they wouldn't accept my device. A suggestion, have people upload a photo in addition to the survey to get the estimation... Overall I was frustrated at the experience.

Review.Titre: This process was very easy and good.
Review.Contenu: This process was very easy and good.However, it has taken too many days and I still have not received my payment even though it was supposed to be a digital payment.Something terribly wrong.

Review.Titre: Shipping Damage
Review.Contenu: The evaluation of our device was lowered by over $200 because of a flaw that appeared on the screen. That flaw was not there when we sent it in. I am convinced that the laptop was damaged in the package they provided especially since it took over one week in transit to get back to them.  Senders should take pictures of your device and perhaps reconsider the packaging if you want full value from your device.

Review.Titre: Felt like bait and switch
Review.Contenu: Felt like bait and switch.  For a very minor dent payment was reduced

Review.Titre: Don't trust their quote
Review.Contenu: Having a high quote to start with, gave me all the supplies I need to send my Macbook Air in.After getting my device, immediately lowered my quote from $90 to $40. They manufactured a defect that does not exist on my laptop. I immediately requested a return. I will definitely take action if they have either changed or damaged my laptop.---------Update---------After receiving back my MacBook Air, I checked it throughly. Turns out my MacBook Air is intact, it's damaged by neither myself nor phobio. I sold it on CL for $140 a week later. I don't understand why phobio did that. One possibility is that they can't distinguish dust and grease on the screen from cracked screen.

Review.Titre: Don't expect much from this company
Review.Contenu: I was disappointed and disagree with the assessment given to the piece of equipment I sent in as it was in good, working condition.  The image shown in the email I received had a rather blurry photo of an iPad with a foreign language screen showing. There is no way to validate that the item shown is actually the one which belonged to me, as there is no serial number shown.  The mail in process worked well but the final offer was minimal and related documentation very poor.  Bottom line:  Don't expect much from this company.

Review.Titre: Slow & mediocre
Review.Contenu: The process from start to finish in long and fraught with delays. For me it took over a month for 2 phones. Considering this was not the highest paying option, I would not recommend them.

Review.Titre: Very disorganized process
Review.Contenu: The trade in status review was all scattered, not in good orders, as I was trading in multiple devices. And one computer was evaluated wrong, they adjusted the value back to my original value, but still only paid reduced amount. They still owe me $70!

Review.Titre: I was given an initial quote which I…
Review.Contenu: I was given an initial quote which I agreed to. After my iPad was received, I was told there was damage and the quote was reduced by more than half. I responded that there was no damage and the initial quote was honored.  This felt deceptive and like a possible scam. I was glad there was a good response but this should not have been necessary.

Review.Titre: Haven't had a great experience
Review.Contenu: Haven't had a great experience. Sent in my laptop and iPad. Received an email saying my screen had delamination so my credit dropped from $125 to $47 and as of today, I haven't received the $47 rebate. I don't believe there was delamination on the screen. I received my credit for my iPad a couple of weeks ago but have yet to receive the credit on my laptop.

Review.Titre: Shifting price and constant pressure
Review.Contenu: When I started I was told $130 for my iPad. Then $80. Then “it depends.” In their paperwork, they say if they aren’t going to offer the full amount they’ll give you the option to have your device returned free of charge- that isn’t true. They’ll constantly bully and pressure you into trading in your device for less and less money. I’m ashamed Costco would do business with them.

Review.Titre: Where is my money?
Review.Contenu: Not only did you ding the value of the laptop for some minor scratches, you also have not sent the money yet.  Where is it?  Still no money as of October 13th.  Where is it?

Review.Titre: Offered $90 and Recieved $40
Review.Contenu: Offered $90 and recieved $40 because Phobio sent a  photo of a small imperfection on the edge of the MacBook.  Wow, nice scam you have going on.

Review.Titre: Was disappointed with the final amount given for my IPAD Pro
Review.Contenu: Was disappointed with the final amount. Initially $100 was the estimate which I thought was a low amount. There were no damage or visible wear and on my IPAD. It was in a padded cover the entire time we owned it. It was used by an adult on a daily basis. I ended up with only a $35.00. Probably won’t do this trade in again.

Review.Titre: Was disappointed when I received notice…
Review.Contenu: Was disappointed when I received notice my fully intact computer and screen was stated to be damaged and when I reached out to discuss the issue was never responded to.  I will be very cautious trading in my products in the future and take pictures prior to packaging and mailing so I have proof but again the company has to respond to inquiries.

Review.Titre: A New Form of Bait & Switch
Review.Contenu: You promised one amount and actually offered/gave me a MUCH lower amount. I can understand a slight variance but not as much as you offered. I based my new computer buying decision on being close to the original offer. I spent a lot of money on a new computer at Costco. VERY disappointed in Costco for this bait and switch and/or dealing with an organization that operates in this manner.

Review.Titre: Still waiting for my Costco shop card
Review.Contenu: Still waiting for my Costco shop card. It’s been nearly 3 weeks since you have received my trade in and I’m still waiting. Got a reply from the company that they are researching my payment.  Finally got it yesterday in the mail

Review.Titre: Instructions to erase the computer data…
Review.Contenu: Instructions to erase the computer data were inadequate and confusing and at times not doable. There is no customer service number to solve issues. Trade-in was not approved a few times. No proper investigation was done to solve issues.

Review.Titre: Almost 30% of the estimated trade in…
Review.Contenu: Almost 30% of the estimated trade in value was taken off because my package was deemed to be late.  It's true that I did wait until the last minute to send it back, but it was within the time frame.  Fed-Ex, however, did let it sit in a warehouse for about a week with no movement.  I don't see how that was my fault.The reason I was given for the reduction is that since i waited so long, things changed in the market.  Really?  I figured I wouldn't get what was promised.  I'll just sell it privately next time.

Review.Titre: Meh. Wouldnt do again
Review.Contenu: They are unclear on expectations, lowered the offered SIGNIFICANTLY. Recommend using apple trade in instead, I’ve had great experiences with apple trade in. No sleezy activity with apple.

Review.Titre: I still have not received my payment
Review.Contenu: I still have not received my payment. Twice I used the "contact us" button on the website to inquire. I did not receive a response either time.Your instructions were unclear. I chose a digital Shop Card, and in one email, you said my payment will be emailed within three days. In another email, you said it will arrive via USPS.Until the payment step, everything went smoothly. But in my opinion, the payment step is the most important, and it has been the most frustrating.

Review.Titre: Little in Return
Review.Contenu: Was expecting more money for my laptop, so I am disappointed. It’s quite sad that a laptop I bought for $1500 in 2016 was worth $68. It was an easy process, so I’d recommend this service for that, but don’t expect a large return for your electronics.

Review.Titre: Was told my trade-in offer was no…
Review.Contenu: Was told my trade-in offer was no longer valid because it was processed after the time period despite being received within it. Also had my trade-in value reduced significantly due to screen lamination issues that I don’t recall being asked about pre-quote.

Review.Titre: Offer Way Too Low, Not Specific to Memory Upgrades
Review.Contenu: Honestly, I was pretty disappointed in the $130 offer I got for my 2011 iMac 2TB Fusion Drive, a formidable machine, which cost $2000+ brand new and still sells used for about $700. Overall, Phobio's shipping service is great but the trade-in estimate, especially for credit instead of cash, is way too low. I only ended up doing it for the trade-in benefit at Costco, otherwise, I would not have gone this route. Phobio's offer didn't account for a significant upgrade to the memory on my iMac 27-inch. The iMac I traded in was a 2TB Fusion Drive in excellent condition—a significant storage upgrade from the standard 256 GB iMac. The offer is the same for the 256 GB and the 2TB fusion drive models, which retail is more than $300 difference.

Review.Titre: Everything was great until I was to…
Review.Contenu: Everything was great until I was to receive my trade-in gift card. Received a couple e-mails indicating it was delivered and I should have received it, but I haven't. Sent an e-mail to customer support with details a few days ago and no response yet.Followed up with response left here to Phobio customer service and was provided additional info regarding status of gift card.  Thanks

Review.Titre: Do not use this program
Review.Contenu: After receiving a quote for $150, I shipped my Mac. It took a couple of weeks to hear that my trade-I was adjusted to $0 for LCD issues which were never a problem. After contacting the Better Business Bureau, I was contacted again with an adjusted value of $125, which I did receive. I should not have had to contact the BBB to get this resolved, so I do not recommend this program to anyone.

Review.Titre: I was disappointed
Review.Contenu: I was disappointed with the drop in trade in value vs the original offer. I was offered $110 and only got $38. I disagree with the assessment as I have always used extra care in protecting my media equipment. I have always used glass/screen protectors, always kept my tablet in a flip case to protect the shell and screen. This tablet has never been outside the home and has never been used by children and for the assessor to say the screen had lines in it is very unlikely. I did not feel like I could do anything about it so I accepted the offer etc. Sounds redundant I know but I disagree with your assessor.

Review.Titre: You knew my device was 10 years old
Review.Contenu: You knew my device was 10 years old, with all the normal wear and tear that comes with age. Your initial offer should have reflected that knowledge instead of being 3x more than what I actually got paid for my good condition device. I would have gone somewhere else, but it was really "too late" by the time you gave me your final lowball offer. I won't use Phobio again.

Review.Titre: Painfully Slow Way to Get Your Credit
Review.Contenu: Apple uses this company.  They have a very streamlined process - packaging dispatched right away, clear instructions, status updates.  They advertise heavily that they assess your return right away when they receive it.  But then they wait weeks to send the e-gift card...  Strongly suspect they are financing their company off the backs of holding inventory and delaying payables.

Review.Titre: Sneaky Company if folks are not…
Review.Contenu: Sneaky Company if folks are not careful. They tie up with costco and services are good but when they receive the shipment they try to pull a fast one and value your product at a lower price. I refused to accept a lower value and wanted my product back they reviewed again and admitted it was a mistake finally shipping me the true value $$$ card they were expected to provide. Nice folks but watch out.

Review.Titre: I would not use Phobio for a trade in…
Review.Contenu: I would not use Phobio for a trade in again.The risk is too high that the price quoted on a laptop will be slashed once they get the laptop. The laptop was returned without the charge cable extension and the laptop was loosely packed on return.

Review.Titre: Sent item in
Review.Contenu: Sent item in. Timeline for inspection was close to a month. Would not have been inspected if I had not initiated an inquiry. Was told item was not received in box that was sent. After further inspection, my item was located and I was paid as agreed.

Review.Titre: If you want to wait 7 million years for your money....
Review.Contenu: I think it's absolutely ridiculous that it takes 3-5 days after the device is inspected and reviewed for the payment to get sent to processing and then another 3-5 days for you to receive an emailed giftcard. If it was a physical gift card, maybe. I've used plenty of other trade-in companies, but this has by far been the worst experience.

Review.Titre: I received one-third of the value…
Review.Contenu: I received one-third of the value quoted.  My wife's was in significantly worse condition, and she received the full price.  I feel like there was an error, and there isn't a consequence for the service.

Review.Titre: Unfortunately for me you didn’t do the…
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately for me you didn’t do the right thing for me gave you a really clean product plus mouse keyboard plus a thru in a Magic Trackpad 2.Thank you.

Review.Titre: Very lengthy process
Review.Contenu: The packaging provided to send the unit in was nice and easy to use. My only complaint is it took over 3 weeks time from the time your company approved the receipt of the iPad and it met the monetary amount agreed upon till I actually received the gift card. My experience with other companies doing similar tasks has been much quicker.

Review.Titre: Poor instructions for setting up return…
Review.Contenu: Poor instructions for setting up return box.Also offer $65 then when got the IPad found nit picking items to reduce offer to $23.  Very dissatisfied but not going to the trouble of getting it back and finding another offer!

Review.Titre: Efficient service, terrible deal
Review.Contenu: Fairly efficient service, but overall a terrible deal. I was quoted over $500 trade-in for my five-year-old Macbook Pro, which upon inspection was reduced to $200 due to "delamination" of the display coating. This appears to be a standard fault in the coating, and I cannot imagine a five-year-old laptop that *doesn't* have this problem.

Review.Titre: Very poor quality control with…
Review.Contenu: Very poor quality control with inspection of watch or iPhone. I still have no update 20477871303 on my iPhone. The trade in number is 20477871303. I keep looking for an update while all I have received is that it was received. If you have anymore questions please fill free to contact me at phone number (775) 8438037.

Review.Titre: Missing Gift Card
Review.Contenu: Hello, RE: Reference #30595230647, I was told that I would receive a $50 gift card in addition to a $20 gift that was part of the promotional offer. I receive the $50 gift card. I never received that $20 gift card that was part of the promotion. Can you send the $20 gift card?Thanks!Andy Kelly858.610.5266

Review.Titre: If Apple Customer Satisfaction Failed, Phobio Was Likely One of the Causes
Review.Contenu: I sent out my MacBook Air for trade in after the window given so my package had to be returned to me. I packed my laptop along with the USB-C cable and the power adapter and I made sure the body was cleaned and scratch-free (It had been in the protective casing since day-1) before inserting to the trade-in kit. The returned package I received was a completely different box. The Type -C cable was missing and I found some dirty marks on the body that I had to wipe them away to prepare for my next trade-in. The whole experience was below standard

Review.Titre: The box never arrived/customer service didn’t respond initially
Review.Contenu: The box never arrived. When I reached out to customer service online, no one responded. A month later I contacted them again, and they finally sent a new box.

Review.Titre: Money not the same as initial offer
Review.Contenu: While it was good, I didn't appreciate that there wasn't a deadline to get the initial amount back anywhere in the process instructions and then I was told that my initial offer would be reduced due to responding late.

Review.Titre: I honestly recommend trading directly…
Review.Contenu: I honestly recommend trading directly with Apple instead. Trading with Phobio presented several issues: 1) my trade in package was lost by Canada Post (not Phobio's fault, I must add but there are better delivery partners), 2) the process is much much longer. I started the trade in process Oct. 28 and up to now Nov. 16 I have let to receive my device payment because of delayed payment processing. I should give credit to Phobio for how they handled my lost package though. To my surprise, I was approved for the full trade in I was quoted for and they responded to my call and email within 1-2 days. Really, it's just too much headache :(

Review.Titre: Where is my computer?
Review.Contenu: Phobio made a offer to purchase my used MacBook on a trade-in program with Costco.  I declined the offer.  After  2 weeks my device had still not shipped for return.  I called, and they say now that it will arrive back to  me in 3-4 days.  We'll see.

Review.Titre: Not a warm and fuzzy feeling
Review.Contenu: Up until the moment that I received a revised trade-in price for my iPad, things were going well. I was offered $200 for a 10.5" iPad Pro, revised down to $70 for alleged screen issues. It appears as though this happens more than occasionally based on reviews and articles that I've read. I feel deceived and I've requested the return of my tablet.As requested, I sent you an email. I have not heard anything from you. It only confirms my previous comments.This gets worse. I just opened the return shipment of my iPad to find that a large rectangle of adhesive is stuck to the back cover. It proves further how insincere your comment is.

Review.Titre: I followed the instructions...and did…
Review.Contenu: I followed the instructions...and did not receive the full rebate amount 'due to condition' without any further explanation.

Review.Titre: Take pics of your device before sending
Review.Contenu: I, too was VERY unhappy with the final revised offer on my device.  When I sent my iPad to Phobio, it worked perfectly, and was in pristine condition, as it had always been kept in a case, used only by me, and only in my home.In addition, I requested shipping materials from Phobio, to insure (or so I thought) that my device would have the best possible chance of reaching them intact.  Ultimately, I did think that their shipping materials were somewhat flimsy, and I should have used my own supplies.  I received about half of the value I was quoted.  I should have taken detailed pictures of my device before sending it off, so that I would have some chance of justifying my claim.

Review.Titre: Put someone else's (damaged) photos on…
Review.Contenu: Put someone else's (damaged) photos on our account.We surprised and shocked to see that our refund was initially knocked down 62% from what we were expecting. When we looked at the photos of our return, we saw that Phobio had attached a different set of photos of a damaged computer - other than our own - to the account.To their credit, after pointing out the error and asking that they consider that possibly they had inspected the wrong computer, we received the full refund a few days later.While the outcome was positive, the negatives of having the initial knocked down amount, mixed up accounts, and having to contact customer support outweigh the positives.We wonder how often they confuse computers, and leave people, whose computers are otherwise fine, accepting a lower refund amount.

Review.Titre: Phobio separates your charger from your computer
Review.Contenu: UPDATE: They returned the charger that was missing (or, one like it).  However they still offered much less than the original offer, due to some screen pressure marks that are not even visible when the screen is on.  I have seen this on this type of computer, so it's likely a common problem if you ever have put it in a backpack or bag where there is some pressure on the case.  There is no guidance on the Phobio site for how this might affect the value.  Regardless, I am changing the stars from 1 to 2 because they returned the charger.Original review:Phobio offered me less than half of the original offer when they received my computer, so I declined the offer.  This was insulting, but to be expected.  I received my computer back after declining their adjusted offer, but Phobio did not include the charger I sent with the item.  They returned a MacBook charger with a spot for a USB-C cable (without any cable), rather than the original MagSafe adapter I sent with it, and this charger is not compatible with the computer.  This is a different kind of charger entirely from the one that the 2015 MacBooks came with.  Now I have a computer with no charger that I would like to sell but will need to buy a charger to go with it.

Review.Titre: decrease quote
Review.Contenu: I was surprised to see the decrease quote. I hope there will be more explanation about it before I start the process.

Review.Titre: I have received the check yet
Review.Contenu: I have received the check yet. So not sure why you are asking for feedback. Also, I have no idea when it will be coming to me. Not much transparency in the process after the laptop reached to you.

Review.Titre: Phobio undersold the difficulty of…
Review.Contenu: Phobio undersold the difficulty of this.  Poor instruction.  I had to stop and put it aside out of frustration.  That delay cost me $100. Poor experience overall.

Review.Titre: Can't redeem my credit!!
Review.Contenu: I recently traded in my iPhone 6S & old iPad mini. Was offered $90 for both. I was fine with it since I didn't want to take time to sell it myself. However, I received my "credit" via email with only a link to "Redeem My Reward" which when clicked just takes you to the Apple website. There's no virtual gift card with an actual 16-digit card#. I emailed then to find out how to redeem both at said "sorry, go to Apple for answers." Uncool. I just chatted with Apple reps who told me how to check credit balance. There is none. And I can use both credits at once IF I had an actual card# to enter at checkout, which I don't. How the hell do I use my $90?! I want my money! Trade-in was smooth & fairly quick except for actually getting my credit for my items. Not cool.

Review.Titre: Took longer then expected and stand by quoted price
Review.Contenu: Took a longer time then expected to receive the box so I could mail in the computer. Then the price offered was considerably lower then the quoted price...disappointing to say the least.

Review.Titre: 71% Drop in quote; no reasons given
Review.Contenu: I was quoted $240 for a late 2015 21.5" Retina iMac with 8GB RAM and a 1TB HDD. It had served me well since 2015 and being a retiree, it's has seen zero abuse.  It was in pristine condition.  Phobio changed the value to $70 saying it had issues.  I refused and they sent it back.  On the screen were three dot stickies I assumed meant dead pixels.  There was no explanation of why the reduction.  There were/are no dead pixels and there is no eason the initial quote was reduced.  Since then, I've replaced the HDD with a Samsung EVO 860 1TB SSD.  It runs beautifully and I've had it assessed at a value of now $840.  Just wow.  I've never been so glad to have been scammed but that's my unsubstantiated opinion of exactly what happened.  A 71% drop in quote with no details is unacceptable.

Review.Titre: Laptop was in good shape when Sent to…
Review.Contenu: Laptop was in good shape when Sent to youYou said lines on screen Low balled offerNot worth fighting overWould not recommend you dick g

Review.Titre: Bait and switch
Review.Contenu: Payment was half of what they originally quotedNo pictures or documentation of the supposed reason for the drastic decrease in buyback price Seems like a bait and switch

Review.Titre: Incorrectly Told my Laptop Didn't Turn On When It Actually Did
Review.Contenu: Sent in a laptop to Phobio for trade in after receiving a quote online. Its an older Macbook Pro with some surface scratching, etc, but it still powered on fine. Got an email saying they were revising my quote to $0 because the device didn't turn on. I contacted customer service and contested this as it turned on fine when I sent it to them. They said my options were accept $0, or they would send it back. I had them send it back, and, low and behold, it turned on right out of the box. I immediately called Phobio support and was asked to send a photo of the working screen to an email that was provided. I am currently waiting on a response to my photo. Perhaps they will make it right in the end, but if you send a machine to them that was working and they tell you it isn't when they review it, make sure you ask them to send the device back.

Review.Titre: Shipping package to small.
Review.Contenu: I traded in a phone when I bought a new Motorola Razr. The mailing kit contained a package to ship my trade in but my phone would not fit the enclosed packaging.  We received notification that the package was received but never hear from Motorola that the trade in was acceptable.  I'm hoping everything went well and I won't be charged.

Review.Titre: To be honest
Review.Contenu: To be honest, I thought the original quote was $50 the $10 I received is more of an insult than anything.Update:I did receive a response from Phobio which is great to see that a company will respond so I thought I would update my review. I did get the full $50 based on what I am now seeing it was just a bit odd the way it was represented so I am happy with my decision and may use this service again but will make sure I read all the fine print to understand what and how the process works.Moved from 2 to 3 stars based on feedback from Phobio.

Review.Titre: Good / Bad
Review.Contenu: On the bright side, the process was very smooth. On the bad side, I believe Phobio de-valued two of my six computers by far more than they deserved, but had no good means of challenging the valuation, so I just accepted the number. Unhappily.

Review.Titre: Had to call to get my trade-in digital gift card. Emailed it to me.
Review.Contenu: I received an email stating that I would get my digital gift card via email in three business days. Three business days later I got another email saying the exact same thing but I never received the email with the digital gift card. I had to call customer service in order to get the email sent to me with the trade-in amount. The lady I spoke with on the phone was very nice and took care of it very promptly.

Review.Titre: I never received my Costco Shopcard as…
Review.Contenu: 11/30/2023 I never received my Costco Shopcard as promised in 3 business days. I guess I have been scammed.12/12/2023 Update.  There is no telephone support for Phobio.  There is a toll free number but it directs you to send them an email for support.  Trustpilot that asked for the rating of my transaction gave an incorrect email to contact them. Once the correct email was obtained, the response was quick and my issue was resolved. I did have to contact Costco to finalize receipt of my shop card.

Review.Titre: Being an additional service delays the return process
Review.Contenu: What I didn't like from this service was that the package is sent separately and days after the new device arrives and this is not mentioned in advance, this caused me a lot of trouble because i had a trip scheduled and had some plans to ship as soon as I received the new device but this was not possible. Also, there is no need for extra packaging and creating extra waste. The same box where the new device is sent can be used to send the old one. Everything the customer needs should be provided together on the time the new device arrives.

Review.Titre: According to the tracking page the…
Review.Contenu: According to the tracking page the process is still not finished

Review.Titre: Disappointed
Review.Contenu: Disappointed in the long wait between each step.  Took five weeks beginning to end, even though I responded immediately at each step.   Also disappointed in the small price I received for a relatively new iPhone in pristine condition.

Review.Titre: There was damage on the phone that I…
Review.Contenu: There was damage on the phone that I did not know about. The price deduction I did do not believe was fair.

Review.Titre: Had a hard time detaching from the iCloud
Review.Contenu: For some reason my watch didn't detach from the iCloud/Apple, although I did everything correctly.  Phobio ultimately sent me a form to submit to Apple telling what I had done.  Whatever happened then, I don't know, but the return was approved.

Review.Titre: Starting the process went smoothly
Review.Contenu: Starting the process went smoothly.  Offer accepted, label printed and package shipped.  The iPad was inspected and accepted.  Still waiting for the Costco gift card to arrive.

Review.Titre: Who is Phobio
Review.Contenu: I had never heard of Phobio and did not choose them - Motorola chose them as their contractor to process trade-ins for old phones.  Or something like that.  The trade in worked seamlessly, even if the phone only barely fit into the provided box.  What else could one want?  Except to NOT be bothered to review a company I had never heard of and will likely never deal with again...

Review.Titre: I do not know anything about the…
Review.Contenu: I do not know anything about the transaction. I was told that you would buy back my 2020 Samsung for $60.00.I followed the instructions as best I could, hoping I was successful. I have no idea what happened after I put it in the hands of Fedex. so I do not feel I can answer these questions intelligently.

Review.Titre: I was not pleased that the low offer I…
Review.Contenu: I was not pleased that the low offer I received for my device trade in got even lower once it was received by you! And lowered by over half of the original offer!

Review.Titre: Good service. Instructions need to be updated.
Review.Contenu: This is the fourth time I’ve used your service. There was a change in your processes; there’s no shipping kit mailed out anymore. I didn’t know, so I waited for about two weeks and nothing happened so I contacted your company. I was told that you don’t send a shipping kit anymore, which is fine, but the language in the confirmation email was the same. It specifically said to wait for the shipping kit then send the device. The person I talked to apologized and said instructions would be updated accordingly!

Review.Titre: No way to respond
Review.Contenu: I did receive communication about my trade ins.  But in one case I was asked to respond and accept a lower offer for our IPhone.  However, there was no mechanism in the email to accept the offer.  It took numerous attempts to contact Pure Talk and Phobio before I was finally sent an email with a means to accept the offer.

Review.Titre: Your website told me I would be…
Review.Contenu: Your website told me I would be receiving a return box but after waiting 2 weeks I was told, no, they did not supply boxes to Amazon customer. I then used my own box and your label.Your email dated September 13 said I'd receive my payment in "3 to 5 days". I did receive it, but the wording was obscure and I thought it was Spam. I have now received the full amount. Thank you.

Review.Titre: Easy from start to finish - as long as you don’t need to actually talk to a human being.
Review.Contenu: Easy from start to finish. Offer was the highest out of all the online services I could find which was appreciated.Updated: Lowered rating as I had a question and contacted support twice and never got a response. I ended up being able to answer my own question but  I worry, if things don’t go 100% smoothly what the experience would be?

Review.Titre: The refund was prompt
Review.Contenu: The refund was prompt. However, the return drop off instruction is a bit confusion. The instruction said to drop off at FEDEX, but the shipping label was for UPS. Also when I printed out the shipping label, it said the item needs to be received by 3/28 (on month after I submitted the request). But the email I received said the item needed to be received by 3/18.

Review.Titre: I was surprised to see the trade in…
Review.Contenu: I was surprised to see the trade in drop from $130 to $70 because I had inadvertently wiped some file.  I was having trouble transferring data fro my old Mac to the new Mac so I called Apple support and they talked me through the process   I told them I was trading in the old Mac so it was a big surprise to see they had me wipe everything which caused my trade in to de-value

Review.Titre: Product went missing after delivery
Review.Contenu: The process of setting up the trade-in, printing the shipping label and sending my trade-in was smooth. Unfortunately, my device was never checked in, although it was shown to be delivered. I needed to chase this after a couple of weeks. Phobio was quick to issue the agreed upon trade-in value, but it was less smooth than ideal.

Review.Titre: Needs clarity on how long the process takes
Review.Contenu: Canada Post told me you had the phone a week before your tracking showed you'd received it. It took one month from when I shipped it untiI I received the rebate but I was lead to believe it would be 3-5 business days. I wish I'd taken the phone to my local shop for a rebate instead.

Review.Titre: Reduced value with no recourse…
Review.Contenu: My new iPhone wasn’t doing everything as it should in the various apps I use so I put off sending my trade in until I was sure I would keep it. The timing crossed a deadline so they said my trade in wasn’t worth as originally stated which I don’t believe. The links didn’t work for accepting or rejecting the new assessment so after several calls to my carrier and email messages finally a link was provided. My carrier was great, but the experience with Phobio was impersonal and authoritarian.

Review.Titre: Processing took quite a while but it…
Review.Contenu: Processing took quite a while but it was overall a positive experience

Review.Titre: One good, one bad experience.
Review.Contenu: My trade in at Costco was great.  The process was easy and I was given the amount estimated.  So I'm a fan of the Phobio of 2023. That said, my previously trade in with them through Apple (Dec 2020), who uses Phobio, I received only 25% the amount I was quoted.  The iPhone I sent in was in great condition but the first time I sent it in, they said the "Display has 3 or more white spots", so I took it back because there were no issues with the screen. The second time I sent it in, they said the "Camera is not functioning properly".  Apparently the screen healed itself and now there was a different issue ... which of course was not the case because there was nothing wrong with the camera.  I am not the only who experience this too and Verge even wrote an article on it.So Phobio gets 3 stars because I'm still not sure what to expect of them.  They honored their quote in my recent trade in, so maybe the issue I faced 2+ years ago is a thing of the past.  I guess I'll find out with my next trade-in experience, 2-3 years from now.

Review.Titre: Six weeks and still waiting
Review.Contenu: It has been well over a month since I received an email telling me that my payment would arrive soon, and there has been nothing since. And on the website it is very hard to even find a way to make contact. I finally did, and four weeks ago I sent a message asking where my Costco card was, and have heard nothing back. This is very frustrating.UPDATE: They got back to me within a couple of hours of this review being posted, and have worked very quickly to put things right. While it was very frustrating to have this happen, and does mean a bit of extra "work" on my part, I've upgraded the stars to reflect the prompt attention to my problem with this second attempt from me.

Review.Titre: Be patient, it’s a long and unnecessary drawn out process.
Review.Contenu: I liked getting the agreed upon price for my phone.  Problem is, it took about a month and there were too many hoops to jump through.  Answering emails, filling out forms, setting up pins, answering questions I prefer not to answer……..  was paid with a Visa debit card.  Why not Zelle the cash?

Review.Titre: The trade in itself was ok
Review.Contenu: The trade in itself was ok, BUT they wouldn't recognize our address or our friends'. Consequently we had to have our EMPTY BOX sent to Arvada CO an hour away and drive down to get it. That was pretty ridiculous and a waste of time.

Review.Titre: Not a scam, but not pleasant to use, either.
Review.Contenu: Received a trade in confirmation for $830 on March 3, and assurance that payment would be emailed within 3 days.  As of March 16, have not received payment.Their customer service phone number is turned off, and their trade "dashboard" where you're supposed to be able to track your trade-in is "404 - Not found."They smell like a scam organization, or maybe one that has gone bankrupt.Avoid!!!Edit:  Well, it turns out that they are legit, although their user interface is a mess, and customer followup is sketchy.  The payment was in the form of a gift card to a major camera retailer in New York, and that retailer had no record of the payment, and basically lost it.  It took about 8 phone calls, and and an hour on hold, and escalating the issue all the way up the customer service hierarchy,  but they finally found it.  A lot more trouble than it was worth; I could have sold the old computer locally and gotten cash, instead of a gift card that I'll have a hard time using.

Review.Titre: Good but Slow Process
Review.Contenu: The process was sound and it worked.  Honestly, it took almost a month to play out between its start, mailing in the ipad through to its receipt, inspection and then payment through the Costco Shop Card.  I expected it to take 2-3 weeks at most.

Review.Titre: Explanation please
Review.Contenu: Your sending the kit to return my iPad was really good. The directions for using it confused me, but I finally managed to get it packed up and sent to you. Then you reduced the amount you would pay without explaining why. That really annoyed me!

Review.Titre: other options
Review.Contenu: would have like to had a option for cash or other gift card payout rather then just having to have Adarama gift card.

Review.Titre: A trade-in value was not that great
Review.Contenu: A trade-in value was not that great. A day after I shipped my old iPad to phobio, I found a trade-in program from BestBuy. It offered twice as much. What a disappointment!

Review.Titre: Can’t totally review yet because I…
Review.Contenu: Can’t totally review yet because I haven’t received received the Visa reward in the mail yet

Review.Titre: Process was slow and payment was low
Review.Contenu: Process was slow and payment was low. I traded a second phone with Apple and received a higher value and the process was about a week shorter. If I had known about the Apple program I would have used it for both phones.

Review.Titre: We were given a trade-in amount and…
Review.Contenu: We were given a trade-in amount and sent in the said computer. When it was received, the amount fell from $75 to $15 for what reason was unclear.

Review.Titre: Communications as to status was weak
Review.Contenu: Communications as to status was weak.  Device received however not acknowledged for 4+ days after and web site not reflective of receipt.

Review.Titre: Not worth the trouble
Review.Contenu: A trade in price was quoted before I sent in my old Smart Watch. The actual trade in price was a fraction of what I was quoted. In retrospect, I should have just kept it and sold it privately. All the trouble was not worth the $10 trade in for a 2 year device in great condition.

Review.Titre: No box for the iMac
Review.Contenu: No box for the iMac, really stressed me out and i lost 20 bucks on the trade buying bubble wrap and a box.

Review.Titre: Costco gift card, not cash...
Review.Contenu: I did not realize until after I did the transaction that you are paid with a Costco gift card... I was expecting cash.

Review.Titre: I still don’t receive trade-in USD55…
Review.Contenu: I still don’t receive trade-in USD55 Costco shopping card since your email informed me on NOV28.

Review.Titre: The digital Costco card came to my…
Review.Contenu: The digital Costco card came to my junkmail folder. That was inconvenient as I nearly missed it.

Review.Titre: No shipping kit mailed
Review.Contenu: They said they would send me a shipping kit so I waited and waited and waited some more finally I just mailed it in padded envelope then they proceeded to take of money due to “it being late” which really wasn’t my fault but whatever I did get a credit for my phone just not what they said and I never did get my shipping kit

Review.Titre: The estimate was fair but…
Review.Contenu: The estimate was fair but from estimate to receiving the kit to payment was well over 3 weeks.

Review.Titre: Sent the wrong size box for the phone
Review.Contenu: Sent the wrong size box for the phone. Had to get a new box and wrapping to send the phone back. the label was fine.

Review.Titre: Update. Finally received the card.
Review.Contenu: Nothing to report here.

Review.Titre: Did not receive the value I expected.
Easing packaging and sending
Review.Contenu: Easing packaging and sending. Took a long time for gift card to come

Review.Titre: Know it will take about 9 days minimum…
Review.Contenu: Know it will take about 9 days minimum to be paid.

Review.Titre: I felt it was very difficult to…
Review.Contenu: I felt it was very difficult to communicate with people at Phobia.  On another issue, I wish I had taken pictures of my computer, because it had no dents or scratches.  Yet, I was sent pictures of dents on the back????? Without proof on my end, I had no case.  I have learned to take pictures of everything, if I ever deal with Phobia again.

Review.Titre: Long time to receive payment
Review.Contenu: Initial process obtaining the quote and receiving the shipping material was easy. Based on their status page, they received, inspected, and approved my item by 9/8/22 but it has been 3 weeks now and payment still says “processing.”

Review.Titre: I appreciate the fact that I DID…
Review.Contenu: I appreciate the fact that I DID receive a trade-in for my computer; however, I STILL believe it was false advertising. The ad stated I can get up to $700 for my computer. I received $85. PHOBIO/did work with me to get something and I am grateful. Thank you.

Review.Titre: Waiting
Review.Contenu: I want to wait to see if what I was told will be followed through.

Review.Titre: The value of my product was worth me…
Review.Contenu: The value of my product was worth me than your assessment. I felt ripped off.

Review.Titre: Don’t count on the estimate
Review.Contenu: The process was fine but when they received it, they adjusted down their offer dramatically for very minor “nicks”. Be careful what to expect when they give you an estimate. Also take close up pictures of your computer so you can compare with what they have.

Review.Titre: The shipment was damaged en route to…
Review.Contenu: The shipment was damaged en route to your facility. No one contacted me about what to do. I had to reach out to you to ask about who should file for an insurance claim. I received a response and was told I would receive an update in 1-2 business days. However I didn’t hear from anyone so had to follow up again. It took longer than I expected to receive my gift card when I believe that under these circumstances, since you could claim insurance, that you should have sent my gift card immediately.
