Review.Titre: Very involved, not for the faint of heart.
Review.Contenu: Very involved.  However, instructions were specific for the most part.Process is very lengthy.  After receiving approval, notification specified the COSTCO Shop Card would be mailed in approx. 15-20 days.

Review.Titre: The process was long
Review.Contenu: The process was long, much longer than Apple or Amazon's program. I am still waiting for my gift card. Not sure I would use this program again.

Review.Titre: Bad Barcode Delayed Shipment
Review.Contenu: I received the shipper for my laptop. Great construction. I sent my laptop next day but the tracking info didn’t show up on FedEx website for a month. Turns out the barcode was unreadable and delayed the shipment 4 weeks and cost me almost $90 in my trade in since it was late. Not sure if this was on Phobio or the FedEx center so I give 3 stars

Review.Titre: Response time great-  receiving department not great
Review.Contenu: The response time was great; however, you tried to say that the watch that I sent in had a whole in the face.   I sent in a rose gold watch and the picture of the watch that was broken had a stainless case.  So it wasn't even my watch.  Once I sent an email in response the issue was straightened out and I received my Costco gift card quickly.  Need better q&A in your receiving department.

Review.Titre: Reduced refund with no recourse
Review.Contenu: Sent my iPad in with no issues. I get an email with a picture of a screen with apparent flaws. There’s no recourse other than get it back, there’s no way to ensure the pic of the screen flaw was mine (showing the serial number on the screen?) very disappointing.

Review.Titre: Something wrong in process or system
Review.Contenu: Trade in Status still show in-transit 2weeks after tracking shows delivered. Sent several emails and finically status change to process payment. However 1.5 months passed but I have not received the money. Finally found e-gift in junk folder. Don’t know why the site is so unfriendly

Review.Titre: iPad mini return experience
Review.Contenu: It takes awhile to get the return package and the return time window seems rather short. The return package is very easy to use but I live a long way from town so hard to get to FedEx for shipping. My gift card still has not arrived yet and it’s been two weeks.

Review.Titre: Taking forever to get the shop card
Review.Contenu: Taking forever to get the shop card. If I knew it would be taking this long I would have traded in with Apple or chose the online shop card option instead

Review.Titre: Thank you for the opportunity for the…
Review.Contenu: Thank you for the opportunity for the rebate for my older laptop. I wish I'd had a more accurate estimate in the beginning of the process. The estimate I received went from "up to $700" to $70 to $30. I still would've done the rebate and appreciate the $30, though. The process of receiving packaging materials and sending back was very good.

Review.Titre: Bait and Switch on Price
Review.Contenu: The price of the trade in kept being lowered, first from the amount listed when I bought the new computer and then when it was received. It ended up being worth about one third of the original offer. Not sure I would have bothered with sending it in had I known how it would turn out.

Review.Titre: No pre-trade-in support.  No way to get answers to non-FAQs.
Review.Contenu: I received the amount indicated that I was expected to receive in a reasonably timely manner.However, there is no pre-submission support.  There is only support after a trade-in has been submitted and the "confirmation" (or whatever) number is known.  I tried to use that support channel without a number and tried to find out if the watch band needed to be sent with the watch.  I never received any reply to my query.  For a company affiliated with Costco, this is sub-standard.  On the plus side, I ended up sending the watch without any watch bands and it worked out OK.

Review.Titre: The process worked “okay”
Review.Contenu: The process worked “okay” and I eventually received the rebate. But in my opinion, the process took way too long. The rebate should be mailed to the customer immediately,

Review.Titre: Communication counts
Review.Contenu: I ran into problems when I found that all iPads were out of stock right after Christmas and I couldn’t find anew one. I was not going to send my old one in without a new purchase. I had no way to contact the company except to respond to their emails telling me time was running out.  Costco was unable to help. Problems were eventually sorted out but the companies lack of acessability made it frustrating to deal with them.

Review.Titre: Late payment
Review.Contenu: Everything was great until payment time. Got an email that payment through a Costco digital card will be emailed to me within three business days however I never got the e-mail. I contacted phobio who informed me that the card was sent and is probably in my spam email but I never found it. They did respond rather quickly and give me part of the card number and told me to contact Costco card services or go into store to be helped further. I contacted card services and was give the digital card but I wished I didn’t have to go through all of that it took 2 weeks for me to get payment, the rest of the process was flawless.

Review.Titre: If at first you don't receive, request, request again
Review.Contenu: It took 3 tries to actually receive a label and box for the return. I would have sent back the computer weeks earlier. There was no response to any of the emails I sent asking for help. No transparency, no support.On the other hand, the item was refunded at the amount estimated, so I appreciated that.

Review.Titre: Phobio quoted a higher value for my…
Review.Contenu: Phobio quoted a higher value for my device before I sent it in than what they ultimately offered. I was disappointed with the final price they offered, but it was too much of a hassle to get it back and try to sell it elsewhere. I feel like I lost $140.

Review.Titre: Incomplete Explanation
Review.Contenu: While Phobio technically followed their rules, they reduced my quote for being late when my package was in their possession for multiple days before they opened it. Had they opened it or scanned it when received, it would’ve been “on time.” They also don’t break down offer reduction based on factor, so my original quote was reduced by 70% with no explanation of what was due to the item being “late” and what was due to condition. There is no option to contact them for any sort of appeal or for more information. It left a bad taste in my mouth. Still better than an old device sitting around doing nothing I guess.

Review.Titre: My refund was greatly reduced because…
Review.Contenu: My refund was greatly reduced because there was an apparent streak on the screen.  I am not sure how that happened since there was always a protective outer screen on the device.  Did you take off the protective screen?

Review.Titre: The trade in value was significantly…
Review.Contenu: The trade in value was significantly reduced from the quoted value.  There seems to be a disconnect between criteria for estimating trade in value and criteria for actual actual trade in value.  It was not clear why the trade in value was reduced.

Review.Titre: Quick, but value finally offered was 1/3 of original offer
Review.Contenu: They were quick with a inspection of the MacBook Pro I sent in and very quick with the gift card paymentI was disappointed in the inspected value as i had prepped the system per their instructions before packing it, and then they reported that they were not able to do the same thingMy value dropped to 1/3 of what they had originally had offered before I sent it in

Review.Titre: I was send this because of Covid and I…
Review.Contenu: I was send this because of Covid and I didn’t want to go to the Apple store. But my iPad was in excellent condition and was quoted $110 for it but they only gave me $50 after I’d done the trade in. I should have taken it to Apple as they had offered $120 for it. Only thing it had was a weak battery and that was their trade even knowing that because it didn’t have a mark or scratch on it.

Review.Titre: Bait and switch?
Review.Contenu: While the process itself was efficient and quick, the price I received for my laptop was less than half the original quote offered. The reason given for the  difference was “screen delamination.” Yes there was delamination—but that coating is easily removed and there was no mention of that being a potential issue when I received the initial quote. I was just asked if the screen was cracked (no) and if the device powered up normally (yes) and they quoted me a price. Sure they offer to return your device if you don’t like the revised offer but that’s a hassle and they know it. Felt like a bit of a bait and switch to me…I wonder if anyone actually receives what the company initially offers.

Review.Titre: Questionable tactics
Review.Contenu: They waited till they had my phone and then switched 175 original offer. 40$ revised. Told them 175 or  Ship it back and cancel. Asked for a review on the order and asked on a scratched paint warranted the same as a cracked screen agreed with my input offered before pictures of how the phone was sent they reviewed the amount to original.Will wait for the gift card to be received.

Review.Titre: Finally got Trade-in Voucher
Review.Contenu: **Update** After posting on here, someone from Phobio reached out to me and made sure that I got my trade-in voucher.  While I appreciate them sending me my voucher now, I emailed them multiple times in the past inquiring about the voucher. I'm glad this is resolved now. Sent my IPAD in after receiving the box and never received my trade-in voucher.  I have emailed several times and no one has replied.  Now I am wondering if this is a legit company or a scammer.  I ended up purchasing an Apple IPAD outright.

Review.Titre: Scam! (but they eventually made right)
Review.Contenu: said my trade in was good for $400. Then changed it to $390 for some reason before I sent it out. Then came back $0 because they said there was white spots on the screen (I didn't notice this, but the computer was 7 years old so hard to know what to expect) and said it would not power on (also not true, although the batter had issues).UPDATE: After writing this review they got in contact with me and issued me the full amount.

Review.Titre: misleading representation of what value…
Review.Contenu: misleading representation of what value would be given for item. was 25% lower than what was initially communicated.

Review.Titre: Smooth process
Review.Contenu: The trade in for our old Mac MIni went really smoothly, and I just received the card for its value in Costco purchases- if anything could be improved, the instruction sheet that they sent on how to wipe the computer was really hard to understand, but we did our best and shipped it in the mailer, and the rest, thank goodness, is history...

Review.Titre: Painfully slow, but worked out in the end.
Review.Contenu: The trade in took something approaching two or three months. There was some unexplained mixup on Phobio's end that I had to continually contact them about to get corrected. They did eventually come through and sent me the promised trade in value for the device, but it was way slower and took way more effort on my part than it should have.

Review.Titre: We originally got a price which was…
Review.Contenu: We originally got a price which was very attractive, however it was reduced by 50% and no reason given.We had other offers but as they had the computer it would not been easy to get it back.It seems like a bait and switch senecio.

Review.Titre: Questionable evaluation
Review.Contenu: After submitting my iPad mini for what I thought I’d receive $95 I received an email indicating there was something wrong with it and offered $43.  Before submitting I knew that there wasn’t anything wrong.  Only after calling to dispute the claim and person I spoke to agreed with me that I was told I’d receive the $95.

Review.Titre: second trade in...both computers sent…
Review.Contenu: Revised....we recycled two apple laptops after some recent upgrade purchases.   Both were in working condition with no issues.   Initially, both "trade-in" values were significantly decreased.   Phobio contact us after we posted our dissatisfaction on Trustpilot and quickly resolved the issue.

Review.Titre: Phobio has not honored their quote and…
Review.Contenu: Phobio has not honored their quote and sent me a lower quote by 80% for no apparent reason. I should've read the reviews before sending in my unit. I thought a company that works with Apple could be trusted.Update: Phobio gave me full value after contacting them directly with my concerns

Review.Titre: A little disappointed.
Review.Contenu: From the time I got the estimate and sent in the laptop, about 2 weeks, the estimate dropped by $110. Then the link said the card was delivered; but it wasn't. Had to call to see what happened.  Was told he card just sent out the day or so before.  Finally got the card a few days ago.

Review.Titre: I have gone through Phobio twice and…
Review.Contenu: I have gone through Phobio twice and both times I have had to rerequest the mailing box to send in my buy back product. Once I finally received it, things did move very smoothly and timely

Review.Titre: I was disappointed with the significant…
Review.Contenu: I was disappointed with the significant downgrade in value for the MacBooks traded in, but the process was relative smooth.  It was difficult to ascertain status of the trade in from the email links... the web pages required information that was not contained in the referring email.

Review.Titre: One device went from $100 to zero…
Review.Contenu: One device went from $100 to zero saying that it did not start. The only option was a return of the device. I sent it after starting it. There can be better way to check that it started before for example by sending a code or image from the device itself before shipping to phobio.

Review.Titre: I received my second request for a…
Review.Contenu: I received my second request for a review. I have yet to receive the funds for my computer. When I check, your website indicates you are in the process of funding. This has been the status since 2/18/2022

Review.Titre: Not fully confident in this service
Review.Contenu: Receiving the shipping container, packing, and shipping the item was easy and a good service. The trade-in review and payment were reasonably prompt. However, my trade-in value was downgraded by 75% for alleged physical damage. The report was supposed to include a photo of the damage, but none was provided. When I emailed Phobio about that, I received a reply that my trade-in credit was increased to the full amount. There was no comment or other information provided, which is suspicious and bad form. Also in general Phobio doesn't make it easy to contact them. I'll use this service again, but I'll be wary.

Review.Titre: When I started looking at the tablet I…I liked the idea of a trade-in.
Review.Contenu: When I started looking at the tablet I sent to Phobio, I thought it was in very good condition but I just wanted newer model.  After answering questions online that were asked and providing you serial number of iPad, I thought I would get an honest opinion of what my trade-in was worth.  I think, but am not 100% certain, that trade-in amount started at $150.  But when I gave you serial number, I thought that you would realize age of iPad and, based on your experience, could pretty well guess condition of iPad.  Again, I did not really write down anything but I think new value of trade-in dropped to $100.After my unit was sent to Phobio, I was shocked and disappointed to learn that my trade-in value dropped to only $53.  I reluctantly accepted this amount because I reall didn’t need to tablets.

Review.Titre: Mixed Review
Review.Contenu: Quick shipping of return boxes & a reasonable amount of time to check out the returned computers, but it took a long time once the return was approved to get our Costco Shop cards.

Review.Titre: Complaint rescinded
Review.Contenu: Rating updated to three stars. Three stars because it took three weeks for them to tell me "We also no longer do trades associated with the purchase of a new Apple device. Apple handles all of those trades in house now."

Review.Titre: Feedback for price reduction was questionable.
Review.Contenu: I sent in a macbook pro and a macbook air. The feedback they gave for why they priced it less than originally quoted, was vague and strange to me. I didn't agree with at least one "issue" per computer they noted. As someone who works with computers, I found their feedback lacking and questionable. I will not use their service again. I did accept the quote however, as I didn't want to take them back and try selling them elsewhere after sending them to Phobio. I'm sure they know this and don't get asked to return computers often.While I'm sure this is a tough market to be in... if you're going reduce the price, at least be more specific about why.

Review.Titre: Update: they gave me the rest of the money
Review.Contenu: Received a $450 quote for my 2017 MacBook Pro. Just like everyone else here, they downgraded it to $140 because of LCD damage that was absolutely not there when I sent it. They attached a blurry photo that doesn’t reflect the condition I sent it in. Absolutely terrible. Such a scam. My options are take some money or get a laptop back that didn’t have the damage they claim when I sent it in.UPDATE: I reached out to the email address and they did respond and give me the additional $310 I was quoted. I appreciate their attempt to fix it but perhaps need to work on their internal mechanisms so people don't think they're being ripped off.

Review.Titre: Sent in my computer
Review.Contenu: Sent in my computer. Received a note that the screen was broken so the offered amount was reduced. No pictures were attached. It was not sent in with a damaged screen. I simply had to take the reduced offer without much I could do.

Review.Titre: The entire process is streamlined and…
Review.Contenu: The entire process is streamlined and easy. From getting the quote to receiving the gift everything took about a month. I love that they have the option to get a Costco gift card for Apple products which is great because we buy all our electronics from Costco since they have great customer service. My only complaint is that the price I got for my computer was atleast $200 less than what I could’ve gotten if I sold it myself, and definitely lower than I got for my last computer. Otherwise great experience.

Review.Titre: It was a very streamlined process with…
Review.Contenu: It was a very streamlined process with a good amount of communication. My only complaint was it took longer than I expected.

Review.Titre: Didn't recognize PHOBIO
Review.Contenu: I wasn't originally informed that "Phobio.com" was going to handle the Trade-In; I almost JUNKED the incoming emails relating to the return.

Review.Titre: The trade in was easy
Review.Contenu: The trade in was easy. The instructions were clear and easy to follow.However, when I received the Costco card the instructions said to call the phone number on the front of the card. There was no number anywhere to call.

Review.Titre: UPS or FedEx?
Review.Contenu: Be consistent with the shipping service. The website says FedEx but the return package says UPS. Otherwise, everything else is good.

Review.Titre: Easy process Expected better buyback price
Review.Contenu: Entire process went well. Disappointed in what was offered for a phone that was like new out of the box. Other than that everything went well. About, little over 2 weeks for gift cash card from Costco to arrive.

Review.Titre: No Phone Number to Activate Card
Review.Contenu: It would have been an excellent score (5) if it was clear how to activate the card. The paper slip that came with the Costco card said it had to be activated before use and to call the phone in the the card. There was no phone number to call.

Review.Titre: Gave clear guidance on which functions…
Review.Contenu: Gave clear guidance on which functions of iPad had to be turned off and how to wipe the device. Their shipping box was hard to unfold, even the UPS store couldn’t figure it out. But the rebate came in full and on time.

Review.Titre: I followed the instructions
Review.Contenu: I followed the instructions and it worked as advertised.

Review.Titre: New phone and low refund
Review.Contenu: Nothing went poorly. Two weeks is reasonable for the refund. I am disappointed in the value of only $209. The phone was new as of October 2023 and had no issues. I expected the full $250 possible.

Review.Titre: Instruction Confusion
Review.Contenu: There were 2 points of confusion to me. The online information indicated that I should send all accessories (sd card, charger & cord) with the return. The instructions with the box sated not to send those. The online video shows the iPad being loaded face up. The instructions with the return box state to load or face down.

Review.Titre: Great Transaction
Review.Contenu: There was a little administrative hiccup in my shipment being recorded, but they fixed it quickly, and everything else was great, quick, and handled well.  Thanks!

Review.Titre: Everything was great except….
Review.Contenu: Everything was great except the instructions to activate the card.  There are NO instructions on the front of the card to activate it.

Review.Titre: I sent two phones in on the same day…
Review.Contenu: I sent two phones in on the same day one phone was five star and other phone was three stars. The packaging to send phones was excellent. Easy to use and process. Price received was about right for one phone and so so for the other. First phone processed and paid. The second phone seemingly lost in the process and payment slow, requiring follow-up multiple times. I did get paid for both phones but the experience was uneven considering I sent both phone on the same day.

Review.Titre: Smooth Process
Review.Contenu: The trade in process runs very smoothly; however, to complete the total transaction seems to take too long.

Review.Titre: Not a bad experience.
Review.Contenu: Not a bad experience.However, I wish you guys also accept a bit outdated models up to 3-4 years which works normally.The devices in your reward ranges are very limited.Thanks.

Review.Titre: I dont agree with the value hit it is…
Review.Contenu: I dont agree with the value hit it is what it is im more questions on why have it been so long and I have not gotten my money

Review.Titre: The directions were perfect and…
Review.Contenu: The directions were perfect and everything arrived as described.  The only issue is that the actual Costco card took a while to arrive.

Review.Titre: Quick responses from support
Review.Contenu: Quick responses from support.  Smooth process, except when I went to use the digital card at Costco, the clerk would not accept my screenshot of the bar code.  More emphasis on actually PRINTING the e-mail for digital use would make sense to me.  She was actually very rude about not using the camera screen shot.

Review.Titre: Instructions were conflicting or…
Review.Contenu: Instructions were conflicting or incomplete. The instructions for wiping my Mac mini were not consistent with my operating system. I think they were for an older operating system. The shipping label was a UPS label although it said to go to FedEx. I was given a $300 Costco shop card promptly but Apple would’ve given me $410.

Review.Titre: Almost 5 Stars
Review.Contenu: Almost a 5 Star rating, except for one thing: There was no official, final word upon examination of my trade-in phone. They said they had received it and would be looking it over, but that's the last I heard. So I just kept my eye on my CC, and since the charge for the new phone didn't change, I figured all was well.

Review.Titre: Great service/a price for convenience
Review.Contenu: My trade in experience was seamless. I didn’t encounter any issues at all. The Apple Store would have given me more (I think the quote was $35 higher) for my ipad8 than Phobio did.  However, it would have been less convenient for me to go there, so basically I paid for the convenience by taking a lower trade in amount. Phobio didn’t really offer a way to negotiate for a value that would match Apple, however the trade in process was simple, convenient, and worked exactly as they said it would.

Review.Titre: I never received my trade in credit…
Review.Contenu: I never received my trade in credit after shipping a Mac Mini in. I originally left a 1 start review but Phobio was very responsive and got me in touch with Shop Card. They were able to resend the reward email and I got my credit. They suspect it went to the junk folder and got deleted before I was able to check.

Review.Titre: The process is fairly quick but there…
Review.Contenu: The process is fairly quick but there is a slight  delay between sending the parcel and receiving the approval for the compensation. Reliable and while the amount compensated may be less than expected, there is the idea that we all profit by creating awareness for recycling electronics like cellphones , that we no longer use.

Review.Titre: Hiccup in the process not easily remedied
Review.Contenu: The process was smooth except for receiving a shipping label that was incomplete and not accepted at UPS.  Finding out what to do about the situation was not easy but once I found out from Costco Concierge Service how to email help at Phobio, the situation was remedied expediently.  It necessitated another trip to the UPS store.

Review.Titre: Return box size
Review.Contenu: The only complaint that I have (and why I only rated 4 stars) was that the insert for the phone in the return box was too small for the phone I was trading in (Motorola Razr 5G). The insert was sealed around three sides, creating a kind-of pocket to slip your phone into, but the Razr was too thick and too tall so all of the seals split.

Review.Titre: 2019 iMac
Review.Contenu: For the most part it was a good experience. I will list the problems first. The computer listed after entering my serial number was not a match for the computer I was trading in. I needed to email them to find out how to proceed which took extra time and effort. Everything got resolved and I was sent an empty box to ship out the computer. The box came heavily damaged and the instructions for packing the computer were different than the box and packing materials I was sent. I did extra taping and used my own packing material to ship it. The acceptance and Costco card came and everything ended up being fine. The experience was good with the exceptions listed above!

Review.Titre: Box did not fit my phone
Review.Contenu: Return Box's insert did not fit my phone (2022 moto g stylus, LTE) . I had to creatively break the insert down and use tape to make it fit. But happy with the price and simple application and notifications on status

Review.Titre: Almost 5 Stars
Review.Contenu: Almost 5 Stars.  BUT, I had to spend hours emailing Phobio and calling Costco.  Phobio provided reasonably prompt responses to inquiries, although I did not always agree with the answers.  Ongoing issue with shipping via UPS Ground from Hawaii turned out to be more of a UPS issue, although this is kind of hard to explain because we exchanged numerous emails. Being able to talk to someone would have helped.  Phobio ultimately honored the original quote, although I was not able to meet the date due to issues with Apple and UPS.  Note: Experience started on 10/16/22 and ended on 1/6/22.

Review.Titre: First time using Phobio
Review.Contenu: This is my first time trading a ipad through Phobio.  I really never used the device so I figured I trade it in through Costco which brought me here.As of 8/21/2023, it's been more than 15 days since I haven't recieved my physical Costo Shop Card.  It would be nice to know when it will arrive, or get some sort of usps tracking info.Otherwise the trading process is decent.

Review.Titre: Might need to find another shipping…
Review.Contenu: Might need to find another shipping partner.  Getting the return kit went fine.  Packed the iPad up and dropped it off at my local FedEx location.  It then went to the local sorting facility where it sat for 2.5 months.  After getting no where with FedEx customer support, I contacted Phobio and they processed my return payment right away.  So if your return gets stuck, contact Phobio, not FedEx.

Review.Titre: The whole process was super smooth…
Review.Contenu: The whole process was super smooth after a bit of a mix up. I was waiting for over a week for a shipping kit and finally emailed to inquire, apparently they don’t provide those anymore and then it wasn’t marked as received so I waited a bit before emailing. They responded so quickly and I had the money within days. I got a fair payout for my phone and didn’t have to deal with a hassle of selling online or lowballing at pawn shops.

Review.Titre: Overall experience was great
Review.Contenu: Overall experience was great. Easy to follow steps for finding out the quote. Great tracking and quick turnaround once they got phone. I tried to email customer service twice to ask a question but never heard back otherwise I would have given 5 stars.

Review.Titre: Phobio provided clear instructions for…
Review.Contenu: Phobio provided clear instructions for wiping data, packaging my device and timeline for payout. The money received was similar to Apple, but we wanted to utilize the Costco card. My only issue was lost shipment of the return box twice. I don’t know if this was FedEx or Phobio but it required additional communication and time to resolve.

Review.Titre: After a month or more of waiting after…
Review.Contenu: After a month or more of waiting after shipping my phone, and hearing nothing from Phobio, I reached out to them. My phone still showed as "in transit" to Phobio on the UPS website. The Phobio customer assistance person I spoke with was friendly and efficient and had my gift card emailed to me the next day. So not perfect but a perfect ending.

Review.Titre: No response to inquiry about submittal
Review.Contenu: It took two attempts to get my trade in complete. I messed up the 1st attempt and sent at least 5 messages with no response.  I finally was able to contact someone by sending a message outside of my original submittal/tracking number.  Ultimately I had to repeat the trade in process a second time.  There were no issues second time around.

Review.Titre: Helpful service
Review.Contenu: The company provides packaging to send the recycled laptop as well as clear instructions on how to prep it for return.The online tracker is good to follow the progress of the return (except in the last part - payment).

Review.Titre: Thankful for the Integrity
Review.Contenu: I incorrectly inputted my computer information prior to sending my device. The company assessed my computer and determined that it was worth more. They gave me the extra amount. My only negative comment is the trade-in instructions say to drop of the device at a Fed-Ex location. However, the label (at least for my device) was for UPS.

Review.Titre: 1 star off because Bestbuy offer $150…
Review.Contenu: 1 star off because Bestbuy offer $150 with the same generation of the iPad, but it is much easier to use the Costco gift card.

Review.Titre: Easy to follow instructions
Review.Contenu: Easy to follow instructions. The negative part is Motorola did not send me a full charging system. The packaging only came with a cord. I am unable to plug into a socket for turbo charging like all of my previous Motorola phones.

Review.Titre: I am pleased that you accepted my iPad…
Review.Contenu: I am pleased that you accepted my iPad into your program. I do believe that iPad was worth more then I received, and also, I think you could possibly expedite your system, as it did take longer than I expected.Thank you, Rob Harper

Review.Titre: I was pleased with the process and…
Review.Contenu: I was pleased with the process and outcome. But there was a delay in communication that warranted me reaching out to check on the status of my trade in. I was contacted swiftly by the support team and I eventually received my gift card. I understand that at times the company may be overwhelmed with products, but a better communication process should be considered. I would definitely use this program again for future trades.

Review.Titre: Message told me that I was supposed to…
Review.Contenu: Message told me that I was supposed to receive a return kit (box and mailing label) but in fact I just got a return label by e-mail. Confusing. After asking I was told that there is no such thing as a return kit in Canada. Just a return label.

Review.Titre: Lovely Surprise
Review.Contenu: This was an easy process that I wasn't aware of. I was a little disappointed to receive my initial quote because I was sure when you got my ipad and saw that it was pristine from being in a case forever, that I might get a little more for it but overall I am pleased with this process.

Review.Titre: The process was great until the end
Review.Contenu: The process of explaining what needed to be done to evaluate the machine was very clear. The empty box was delivered, very easy to do and to send back. The only reason I did not give it a 5 is that they agreed on the rebate, but it is taking a very long time for me to get the card. It is not easy for me to use the digital payout, but why does it take weeks to mail me a card?

Review.Titre: Smooth process
Review.Contenu: Overall the process was smooth and the deal was reasonable. The only issue was an email notification sent me with a timeless manner. I followed the first request to remove the device from my apple account, but a subsequent mail sent me next day suggested the problem not resolved yet.

Review.Titre: Great experience with Phobio
Review.Contenu: Great experience with Phobio.  Traded in an old MBP17 and got a virtual Apple gift card.  Will definitely use their services again.

Review.Titre: Easy transaction just a little on the…
Review.Contenu: Easy transaction just a little on the slow side in my opinion....but not enough not to do this again.

Review.Titre: Might have gotten a bit more for my…
Review.Contenu: Might have gotten a bit more for my trade-in elsewhere but the process was clear, simple, easy and connected to a company I trust.  Very good experience.

Review.Titre: Getting a hold of customer service?
Review.Contenu: I could not find a phone number or find anyway to get a hold of you to ask questions or if there is a problem. Unfortunately everything worked out and I received my COSTCO shop card.

Review.Titre: The compensation for my 4 year old Mac…
Review.Contenu: The compensation for my 4 year old Mac was adequate. The directions of steps to take to prepare my Mac was useful. The timeline you provided was on target and helpful.

Review.Titre: Super easy trade in experience
Review.Contenu: Super easy trade in experience I had sent message via the website with no response which i why I’d didn’t give a 5 star rating

Review.Titre: Sent everything I needed
Review.Contenu: Sent everything I neededThe inside “envelope” was too small for my phone so had to improvise.

Review.Titre: Easy and painless
Review.Contenu: Easy and painless. Only slight hiccup in getting digital payment which was quickly resolved with a phone call. Would definitely trade in again.

Review.Titre: Fairly easy and simple process
Review.Contenu: Fairly easy and simple process, except for all the rules about cleaning, wiping and unlocking your drives or you won't get paid.

Review.Titre: 4 out of 5 - Good, but takes too long.
Review.Contenu: 1.  Process take too long2.  Otherwise, very professional and understand why Costco (whom I rate highly) does business with Phobio

Review.Titre: Smooth, but took a bit of time
Review.Contenu: The whole experience was smooth and clearly laid out. The only reason for 4 stars is that it took a little over 3 weeks from the moment the package was sent out till I got the refund.

Review.Titre: Prompt and accurate
Review.Contenu: Prompt and accurate, but the relationship w/ Costco should be morewxplicit since we’re wary of phishing anymore. Thx.

Review.Titre: Easy and they keep you informed
Review.Contenu: Easy and they keep you informed. Would have liked it better if I could have just got a Costco e-gift card rather than being mailed a physical card. I think it’s an option, but it wasn’t clear how to do that. I think it should be the default method.

Review.Titre: Mission Accomplished as Stated
Review.Contenu: I was given a quote for my trade in device and was credited the agreed upon amount within the time frame as provided with no issues or concerns. Thank you!

Review.Titre: Link to credit expired- they turned it back on
Review.Contenu: USE GETHELP EMAIL ADDRESS TO GET A RESPONSE. Updated to 4 stars because they finally responded and made the situation right by resending the link to the gift card. So far my experience is 1 star. I would be happy to bump it up to 5 stars if I could just get a response from customer service. I tried using the support portal, "live" chat (it says its not currently live 'today' due to a 'holiday'... it's said that for a week), and today I emailed 'daisyq' directly. My issue is that I did a trade in in July 2021 for two apple devices, with an expected credit on an apple gift card. I received the link to my credits but never clicked them because it said "click to redeem".. to me that meant to redeem/spend the apple credit so I never tried clicking it until I went to go buy a new iphone last week. When I tried the links then I got a message that said the credit has expired. I am hoping this means that the link has expired, and not the actual credit, because never once during the process was I told that the apple gift card would have an expiration date. If it just that the link expires, I would really appreciate a response and that they can turn the link back on for me to use. If Phobio can't make it right in that way then I will absolutely keep this a 1 star review, as I am currently out $200 dollars in money I was promised.

Review.Titre: Grocery Money for Old Phone.
Review.Contenu: This was a very easy way to recycle my old iPhone when I upgraded and get some extra money for groceries. I never know what to do with my old phones so I usually try to trade them in. This time, I upgraded with my carrier and did not have that option. Phobio brought me through an easy online process to choose my phone and the model. Then they asked some very simple questions about what condition my phone was in. They gave me an estimate (more on this later) of what they believed my phone would be worth. I agreed to their estimate and their terms and they sent me a box in the mail. The small box already has a return label inside so I did not have to pay for shipping. I followed the instructions and brought my package to USPS. When they received my phone, they changed their estimate. While I answered all the questions correctly (the phone can turn on, it works and charges fine and the screen is not cracked) they found some dead pixels I never noticed and said there was some wear and tear from dust. This brought my estimate from $150 to $70. They gave me the option to have my phone returned to me for free. Having no use for the phone anyway, I decided to accept the $70. Since I did this through Costco, Phobio sent me a Costco gift card in the mail. The entire process only took about two weeks. Overall, I am very happy and will use this service again in the future!

Review.Contenu: Everything I needed for the phone return was in the box.  The instructions were easy to follow, and it was prepaid.
